page.title: 02Sutton-cum-Lound
page.content: Sutton has one main street with the pub where they serve meals as well as drinks and the Post Office round a triangular village green. There is a church which was built in the fourteenth century with a small graveyard and it is surrounded by trees. There is a general store which sells food and other household items. There is a modern primary school surrounded by a housing estate. The village hall has a play area behind it which has a tennis court, some swings and a small area of grass. Across the road from the church there is a small black-smith's which sells lawnmowers etc. and mends things. There is a riding school with eight horses and you can have lessons at the weekends. Down the main street the houses are mostly old. Sutton has got 286 houses and every night the lights go on.
